SEARCH
Module edu.upc.subgrupprop113.supermarketmanager
Package edu.upc.subgrupprop113.supermarketmanager.controllers

Class DomainController

java.lang.Object
edu.upc.subgrupprop113.supermarketmanager.controllers.DomainController
All Implemented Interfaces:
IDomainController
public class DomainController extends Object implements IDomainController
The DomainController class is a singleton that provides centralized access to the core components of the supermarket management system, including the supermarket and the catalog. It is responsible for managing the interactions between different parts of the domain layer.

    Private constructor to prevent external instantiation.

  • Constructor Details

    • DomainController

      public DomainController()
      Private constructor to prevent external instantiation. Initializes the supermarket and catalog instances to manage.

  • Method Details

    • logIn

      public void logIn(String username, String password)
      Logs a user into the system with the specified username and password. Verifies that no other user is already logged in and checks the provided credentials. If the login is successful, the user is granted access to the system. The supermarket is then initialized with default data. If the file does not exist, the supermarket will start empty.
      Specified by:
      logIn in interface IDomainController
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the user attempting to log in.
      password - the password of the user attempting to log in.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if a user is already logged in.
      IllegalStateException - if the default file is not found.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the username does not exist or if the password is incorrect.

    • closeApp

      public void closeApp()
      Specified by:
      closeApp in interface IDomainController

    • logOut

      public void logOut()
      Logs out the currently logged-in user.
      Specified by:
      logOut in interface IDomainController
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if no user is currently logged in.

    • importSupermarketConfiguration

      public void importSupermarketConfiguration(String filename)
      Imports a supermarket configuration from a specified file, updating the shelving units and catalog with new data.
      Specified by:
      importSupermarketConfiguration in interface IDomainController
      Parameters:
      filename - the name of the file containing the supermarket data to import.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if there is an existing shelving unit distribution or if the product relations are incorrect or the logged user is not the admin.
      IllegalArgumentException - if any imported shelving unit fails validation or if any imported product fails the restrictions of the catalog.

    • exportSupermarketConfiguration

      public void exportSupermarketConfiguration(String filename)
      Exports the current supermarket configuration to a specified file, including the product catalog and shelving units.
      Specified by:
      exportSupermarketConfiguration in interface IDomainController
      Parameters:
      filename - the name of the file to which the supermarket data will be exported.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the current user is not an administrator.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the export fails

    • loggedAdmin

      public boolean loggedAdmin()
      Specified by:
      loggedAdmin in interface IDomainController

    • createSupermarketDistribution

      public void createSupermarketDistribution(int shelvingUnitsHeight, List<String> temperatures, List<Integer> quantities)
      Creates the distribution of shelving units in the supermarket according to specified heights, temperature types, and quantities.

      This method takes in a shelving unit height, a list of temperature types, and a corresponding list of quantities to define each shelving unit. Each temperature type in temperatures must have a corresponding quantity in quantities, and both lists must be of the same length.

      Specified by:
      createSupermarketDistribution in interface IDomainController
      Parameters:
      shelvingUnitsHeight - the height of each shelving unit
      temperatures - a list of temperature types for each shelving unit, as strings, which must match values in ProductTemperature
      quantities - a list of quantities representing the number of shelving units for each temperature type
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the logged user is not the admin.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the temperatures or quantities lists are null, have different sizes, or contain invalid temperature values. Also, if the supermarket is not empty or if the logged-in user is not the admin.

    • eraseSupermarketDistribution

      public void eraseSupermarketDistribution()
      Specified by:
      eraseSupermarketDistribution in interface IDomainController

    • sortSupermarketByCatalogProducts

      public void sortSupermarketByCatalogProducts(String sortingStrategy)
      Sorts the supermarket shelving units based on the specified catalog sorting strategy.

      This method sets the ordering strategy for sorting the shelving units according to the specified sortingStrategy. It then applies the chosen strategy to sort the products of the catalog in the supermarket's shelving units.

      Specified by:
      sortSupermarketByCatalogProducts in interface IDomainController
      Parameters:
      sortingStrategy - the sorting strategy to be applied, which determines the order in which catalog products are placed in shelving units
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the logged user is not the admin.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified sorting strategy is invalid

    • sortSupermarketProducts

      public void sortSupermarketProducts(String sortingStrategy)
      Sorts the products within the supermarket's shelving units based on the specified sorting strategy.

      This method sets the ordering strategy to arrange products in shelving units according to the provided sortingStrategy and then applies this strategy to sort the products.

      Specified by:
      sortSupermarketProducts in interface IDomainController
      Parameters:
      sortingStrategy - the sorting strategy to be applied, which determines the order in which products are arranged within the supermarket's shelving units
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the logged user is not the admin.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified sorting strategy is invalid

    • addProductToShelvingUnit

      public void addProductToShelvingUnit(String productName, int height, int shelvingUnitPosition)
      Adds a specified product to a shelving unit at the given position and height.

      This method retrieves the product with the specified name from the catalog and places it at the specified position and height within the shelving unit.

      Specified by:
      addProductToShelvingUnit in interface IDomainController
      Parameters:
      productName - the name of the product to add to the shelving unit
      height - the height level within the shelving unit where the product should be placed
      shelvingUnitPosition - the position of the shelving unit in which to place the product
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the logged user is not the admin.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the product with the specified name is not found in the catalog

    • removeProductFromShelvingUnit

      public void removeProductFromShelvingUnit(int height, int shelvingUnitPosition)
      Removes a product from a specified position within a shelving unit.

      This method removes the product located at the specified height within the shelving unit at the given shelvingUnitPosition in the supermarket.

      Specified by:
      removeProductFromShelvingUnit in interface IDomainController
      Parameters:
      height - the height position within the shelving unit from which to remove the product
      shelvingUnitPosition - the position of the shelving unit in the supermarket's distribution
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the logged user is not the admin.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified height or shelving unit position is invalid or the logged user is not the admin.

    • swapProductsFromShelvingUnits

      public void swapProductsFromShelvingUnits(int position1, int position2, int height1, int height2)
      Swaps two products between specified positions within shelving units.

      This method exchanges the products located at the specified positions (position1, height1) and (position2, height2) within the supermarket's shelving units.

      Specified by:
      swapProductsFromShelvingUnits in interface IDomainController
      Parameters:
      position1 - the position of the first shelving unit involved in the swap
      position2 - the position of the second shelving unit involved in the swap
      height1 - the height level within the first shelving unit from which to swap the product
      height2 - the height level within the second shelving unit from which to swap the product
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the logged user is not the admin.
      IllegalArgumentException - if any of the specified positions or height levels are invalid

    • modifyShelvingUnitType

      public void modifyShelvingUnitType(int position, String temperatureType)
      Modifies the temperature type of a shelving unit at the specified position.

      This method sets the temperature type of the shelving unit at the given position to the specified temperatureType. The temperature type must match one of the values in the ProductTemperature enum.

      Specified by:
      modifyShelvingUnitType in interface IDomainController
      Parameters:
      position - the position of the shelving unit to modify
      temperatureType - the new temperature type for the shelving unit, as a string
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the logged user is not the admin.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the temperatureType is invalid, if the position is out of bounds or if the shelving unit has products in it.

    • addShelvingUnit

      public void addShelvingUnit(int position, String temperatureType)
      Adds a new shelving unit at the specified position with the specified temperature type.

      This method creates a shelving unit with the given temperature setting, placing it at the specified position in the supermarket's distribution of shelving units and moving the next ones to the next position.

      Specified by:
      addShelvingUnit in interface IDomainController
      Parameters:
      position - the position in the distribution where the shelving unit should be added
      temperatureType - the temperature setting for the shelving unit, as a string, which must match a value in ProductTemperature
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the logged user is not the admin.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified temperature does not match any value in ProductTemperature

    • removeShelvingUnit

      public void removeShelvingUnit(int position)
      Removes a shelving unit from the supermarket at the specified position.

      This method deletes the shelving unit located at the given position from the supermarket's shelving unit distribution.

      Specified by:
      removeShelvingUnit in interface IDomainController
      Parameters:
      position - the position of the shelving unit to remove
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the logged user is not the admin.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified position is out of bounds

    • swapShelvingUnits

      public void swapShelvingUnits(int position1, int position2)
      Swaps the positions of two shelving units in the supermarket.

      This method exchanges the shelving units located at position1 and position2 within the supermarket's shelving unit distribution.

      Specified by:
      swapShelvingUnits in interface IDomainController
      Parameters:
      position1 - the position of the first shelving unit to swap
      position2 - the position of the second shelving unit to swap
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the logged user is not the admin.
      IllegalArgumentException - if either position1 or position2 is out of bounds

    • emptyShelvingUnit

      public void emptyShelvingUnit(int position)
      Empties all products from the shelving unit at the specified position.

      This method removes all products stored within the shelving unit located at the given position in the supermarket's shelving unit distribution.

      Specified by:
      emptyShelvingUnit in interface IDomainController
      Parameters:
      position - the position of the shelving unit to empty
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the logged user is not the admin.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified position is out of bounds

    • supermarketHasProduct

      public boolean supermarketHasProduct(ProductDto product)
      Checks if the supermarket shelves have a product with the specified name.
      Specified by:
      supermarketHasProduct in interface IDomainController
      Parameters:
      product - the product dto to search for in the supermarket
      Returns:
      true if the product is found in the supermarket, false otherwise
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the product is not contained in the catalog.

    • createProduct

      public void createProduct(ProductDto productDto)
      Creates a new product in the catalog with specified attributes. The related products are defined all to zero.

      This method defines a product with the specified name, temperature, price, image path, keywords, and related products. Related products are retrived from the catalog to specify a relation with all of the,. The product is then added to the catalog.

      Specified by:
      createProduct in interface IDomainController
      Parameters:
      productDto - is a DTO containing the definition of a new product
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the logged user is not the admin. Also if the image of the product cannot be copied.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified temperature does not match any value in ProductTemperature. If any related product specified in relatedProducts is not found in the catalog or if the product definition is invalid.

    • removeProduct

      public void removeProduct(String productName)
      Removes a product from the catalog by its name.

      This method deletes the specified product from the catalog, identified by its name.

      Specified by:
      removeProduct in interface IDomainController
      Parameters:
      productName - the name of the product to be removed from the catalog
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the logged user is not the admin.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified product does not exist in the catalog

    • modifyProduct

      public void modifyProduct(ProductDto productDto)
      Modifies the details of an existing product in the catalog.

      This method updates the price, temperature, image path, and associated keywords for a product specified by its name. It retrieves the product from the catalog using the provided product name and modifies the product's properties based on the provided

      Specified by:
      modifyProduct in interface IDomainController
      Parameters:
      productDto - is a DTO containing the expected changes
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the logged user is not the admin. Also, if the image cannot be deleted (when necessary).
      IllegalArgumentException - if the product name does not exist in the catalog. If the provided temperature is not a valid enum value for ProductTemperature. Also, if the image path is not valid.

    • modifyProductRelation

      public void modifyProductRelation(RelatedProductDto relatedProductDto)
      Modifies the relationship between two products in the catalog.

      This method updates the relationship between two products based on a given relation value. It retrieves both products from the catalog using their respective names and then updates the relation between the products with the specified value.

      Specified by:
      modifyProductRelation in interface IDomainController
      Parameters:
      relatedProductDto - containing the information for the modification
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the logged user is not the admin.
      IllegalArgumentException - if either of the products does not exist in the catalog. If the relation cannot be modified for any other reason (e.g., invalid relation value).

    • searchProduct

      public List<ProductDto> searchProduct(String searchText)
      Searches for products in the catalog based on the provided search text.

      This method performs a search operation on the product catalog, returning a list of products whose names or attributes match the given search text. The search is typically performed using keywords, product name.

      Specified by:
      searchProduct in interface IDomainController
      Parameters:
      searchText - The text used for searching products.
      Returns:
      A list of Product objects that match the search criteria. If no products match, an empty list is returned.

    • getTemperatureIcon

      public String getTemperatureIcon(String temperature)
      Retrieves the absolute path to the specified temperature-related icon.

      The icon corresponds to one of the predefined temperature storage types:

      • AMBIENT: Icon representing ambient temperature storage.
      • REFRIGERATED: Icon representing refrigerated storage.
      • FROZEN: Icon representing frozen storage.

      Specified by:
      getTemperatureIcon in interface IDomainController
      Parameters:
      temperature - The temperature type as a String. Valid values are "AMBIENT", "REFRIGERATED", or "FROZEN". Case-sensitive input is expected.
      Returns:
      The absolute path to the corresponding icon as a String. The path is constructed using the default temperature directory and the respective icon file name.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the provided temperature type is invalid.

    • isLogged

      public Boolean isLogged()
      Returns whether a user is currently logged in.
      Returns:
      true if a user is logged in, false otherwise.

    • getErrorImage

      public String getErrorImage()
      Retrieves the absolute path to the default error image.

      This image is used as a fallback when a temperature-related icon or other expected image is not found. The method constructs the path using the assets directory for temperature images and appends the "assets/error-img.png" file name.

      Specified by:
      getErrorImage in interface IDomainController
      Returns:
      The absolute path to the error image as a String.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the assets directory path cannot be resolved.
